lines.text: If you want someone to love you, open your heart. If you want someone to be obsessed with you, close it.
your faith, your fortitude, and your family. Good night.
[Profit holds up a syringe]
I have diabetes.
Then you shouldn't shoot heroin.

[Voice over]
Anyone who thinks controlling people is a science is dead wrong.
[Spoken]
It's an art.

[speaking to Gail]
Gail, the key to getting where you want to go is the choices you make.

[voice-over]
When a crisis hits, the key is, never be afraid to improvise.
The day he gets hit by a bus, I believe in God again.

Right after old Douggie had his little mid life crisis, chucked his company and joined a monastary... had to take one last shot at me before shaving his head donning his robes... Nothing like a monk with a grudge.

[voice-over]
We must welcome adversity and embrace struggle. And no matter what we get from life, never give less than 100%. Of course at the end of every battle-weary day, we fold ourselves into peaceful darkness and find comfort in those gentle words -
[spoken]
good night.
I thought revenge would feel good and I'm sure that he deserves whatever he gets, but it doesn't feel right.
'Course it doesn't, Gail. Revenge is pointless. It's a tool for the weak. And you're not weak.
[looks over at the box containing Dr. Batewell]
Not any more.

[voice-over]
The key to real success is to take all your fears and put them in a box and lock them away. Of course not every evil can be tied up in a neat little package. But that's the challenge - to face our own personal darkness and to put our demons where they can't hurt us any more, to do what we can to make the world
[spoken]
a better place.
Gee is that all? I mean, after this comes out, I might still be able to get a job... wearing a hair net and asking "Would you like fries with that?"
I can imagine a holocaust of lawsuits and debt. I can imagine being eaten alive by bottom-feeding cannibals. I can even imagine prison.
